bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG_LOCK[2:0]
bitfields.description:
Boot config lock
Configures the locking of EFUSE bits for fuse #3, #4, #5, #6, #7 and fuses #11 - #22. - bit 0: When set, blocks programming. - bit 1: Reserved. - bit 2: When set, blocks reading.

bitfields.name: PRINCE_CFG_LOCK[2:0]
bitfields.description:
Prince Config Lock
Configures the locking EFUSE bits for fuses #23 - #31. - bit 0: When set, blocks programming. - bit 1: Reserved. - bit 2: When set, blocks reading.

bitfields.name: CUST_LOCK0[2:0]
bitfields.description:
CUST Lock 0
Configures the locking of EFUSE bits for fuses #43, #44, #45 and #46. - bit 0: When set, blocks programming. - bit 1: Reserved. - bit 2: When set, blocks reading.

bitfields.name: CUST_LOCK1[2:0]
bitfields.description:
CUST Lock 1
Configures the locking of EFUSE bits for fuses #47, #48, #49 and #50. - bit 0: When set, blocks programming. - bit 1: Reserved. - bit 2: When set, blocks reading.

bitfields.name: CUST_LOCK2[2:0]
bitfields.description:
CUST Lock 2
Configures the locking of EFUSE bits for fuses #51, #52, #53 and #54. - bit 0: When set, blocks programming. - bit 1: Reserved. - bit 2: When set, blocks reading.

bitfields.name: CUST_LOCK3[2:0]
bitfields.description:
CUST Lock 3
Configures the locking EFUSE bits for fuses #55 - #62. - bit 0: When set, blocks programming. - bit 1: Reserved. - bit 2: When set, blocks reading.

registers.name: LIFE_CYCLE
registers.description: Life cycle state, debug setting, and ROTK setting

bitfields.name: LIFECYCLE[7:0]
bitfields.description:
Life cycle state.
This field can be used to advance life cycle state. Below are the allowed values for this field. Use of other values may lead to bricked state.

bitfields.name: NIDEN_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Non-secure non-invasive debug.

bitfields.name: DBGEN_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Non-secure invasive debug.

bitfields.name: SPIDEN_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Secure invasive debug.

bitfields.name: SPNIDEN_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Secure non-invasive debug.

bitfields.name: CPU1_NIDEN_dis
bitfields.description: Disable CPU1 non-invasive debug.

bitfields.name: CPU1_DBG_dis
bitfields.description: Disable CPU1 invasive debug.

bitfields.name: DSP_DBGEN_dis
bitfields.description: Disable DSP debug.

bitfields.name: ISP_CMD_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Enter ISP Debug mailbox command.

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Set FA mode  Debug mailbox command.

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_dis
bitfields.description: Disable Mass erase Debug mailbox command.

bitfields.name: UUID_CHECK_ENF
bitfields.description: Enforce UUID checking during debug authentication

bitfields.name: RoTK0_dis
bitfields.description: Revoke Root of Trust key 0.

bitfields.name: RoTK1_dis
bitfields.description: Revoke Root of Trust key 1.

bitfields.name: RoTK2_dis
bitfields.description: Revoke Root of Trust key 2.

bitfields.name: RoTK3_dis
bitfields.description: Revoke Root of Trust key 3.

bitfields.name: LIFECYCLE_DP[7:0]
bitfields.description: Duplicate of the LIFECYCLE fuse value.

registers.name: KEY_REVOKE
registers.description: Image key revoke and PRINCE, PUF, and NXP provisioning firmware setting

bitfields.name: DBG_KEY_REVOKE[7:0]
bitfields.description:
Debug key revoke.
This field is combined with 
CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU and CMPA.VENDOR_USAGE fields to form a 32-bit value which is compared with vendor usage field in debug credential certificate.  Only if the values match debug access is granted.
CC_VENDOR_USAGE = { CMPA.VENDOR_USAGE[31:16], 
CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU[15:8], 
(CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU[7:0] | OTP.DBG_KEY_REVOKE[7:0]) }

bitfields.name: IMAGE_KEY_REVOKE[7:0]
bitfields.description:
Image signing key revoke.
This field is combined with 
CFPA.IMAGE_KEY_REVOKE field to form a 32-bit value which is compared with IskCertificate.constraints field during image authentication. If the values don't match image authentication fails.
ISK_CONSTRAINT[31:0] = {CFPA.IMAGE_KEY_REVOKE_VU[23:0],  OTP.IMAGE_KEY_REVOKE[7:0] }

bitfields.name: PUF_ENROLL_DIS
bitfields.description: Block PUF enrollment.

bitfields.name: DIS_NXP_FW
bitfields.description: Block NXP signed SB3 loading.

registers.name: BOOT_CFG
registers.description: ISP pin selection setting and boot configuration setting

bitfields.name: Boot_FlexSPI_Dis
bitfields.description: FlexSPI boot disable.

bitfields.name: Boot_flash_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable boot from internal flash.

bitfields.name: Boot_IFR0_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable boot from IFR0 (as SBL).

bitfields.name: Rec_Boot_SPI_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable recovery boot from external 1-bit SPI flash connected to FlexComm ports.

bitfields.name: Rec_Boot_IFR0_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable recovery boot from IFR0 area( 0x0100_8000 to 0x0100_FFFF).

bitfields.name: PinSel_SPI_Rec_Boot_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable logic related to forcing  recovery boot based on ISP pin state.

bitfields.name: ISP_UART_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable UART interface in ISP mode.

bitfields.name: ISP_I2C_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable I2C interface in ISP mode.

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable SPI interface in ISP mode.

bitfields.name: ISP_USB0_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable USB0 interface in ISP mode.

bitfields.name: ISP_USB1_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable USB0 interface in ISP mode

bitfields.name: ISP_CAN_Dis
bitfields.description: Disable CAN interface in ISP mode.

bitfields.name: ISP_DISABLE[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Disable ISP mode entry points.
ISP mode can be entered through pin assertion, debug mailbox command, image verification failure and ROM API invocation

values.name: Disable
values.description: Entry by ISP Pin assertion disabled.

values.name: Disable
values.description: Entry by ISP Pin assertion and debug mailbox command disabled.

values.name: Disable
values.description: Entry by ISP Pin assertion and debug mailbox command disabled.

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED[1:0]
bitfields.description: Boot speed. Selects the core frequency and voltage to use during ROM execution.

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SZ[4:0]
bitfields.description:
Flash remap size.
 FLASH_REMAP_SZ defines the size of the secondary boot image
 (the range of flash addresses that will be remapped)in internal flash, where remapped
address end = (FLASH_REMAP_SZ + 1) * 32 KB. For example, if FLASH_REMAP_SZ = 2,
then the first 96KB of addresses will be remapped to flash bank1 instead of flash bank0
when remap is active. Set this field to 0  if you do not want to use the flash remap feature

bitfields.name: OEM_BANK1_IFR0_USAGE[2:0]
bitfields.description:
Defines flash protection of Bank1_IFR0 area based  on usage.
Note, if the SBL / Recovery image size is more than IFR0 size of 32KB then sectors from user flash can be associated for extended image size using CMPA.REC_IMG_EXT0/1.

values.description: Not determined by ROM (MBC fields are modified by OEM code)
Used as OEM Root of Trust image, in other words secondary boot loader (OEM_SBL). MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1010. Updatable by OEM code later.
Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1011.
Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 0011.
Used as OEM recovery boot image with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to user image.
Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 1011 on ROM exiting to user image.
Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 0011 on ROM exiting to user image.
Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 0001 on ROM exiting to user image.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash auto probe feature enable

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE[2:0]
bitfields.description:
Quad/Octal-SPI flash probe type.
Note, this field is used when FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE[2:0]
bitfields.description:
Define typical Serial NOR Flash types
This field is always used irrespective of FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN value.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES[3:0]
bitfields.description:
Quad/Octal-SPI dummy cycles for read command.
If a non-zero value is programmed in this field, then the value is used to override the default number of dummy cycles for a fast read command read from the serial flash's SFDP information.
Note: this field is only used if FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY[2:0]
bitfields.description:
Q/O-SPI flash interface frequency.
Note, this field is used when FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Use O/QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device.

values.name: NO_RESET
values.description: NO_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is not connected or available.)

values.name: EN_RESET
values.description: EN_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is connected to a GPIO (QSPI_RESET_PIN).)

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PORT[2:0]
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO  port number to use for O/QSPI reset function.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PIN[4:0]
bitfields.description: GPIO  pin number to use for O/QSPI reset function.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Delay after reset before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices.
Note, for POR in addition to this wait time FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME is added.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME[3:0]
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by FLEXSPI_HOLD TIME field.

bitfields.name: PORT_SEL
bitfields.description: Defines which FlexSPI portA/B is used for boot.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM[6:0]
bitfields.description:
Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS). 
The value provided here is loaded into the FLEXSPIn_DLLnCR.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET[9:0]
bitfields.description:
Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support  eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. 
This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. 
FlLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of the second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. 
If this field is left blank boot ROM will not enable FlexSPI remap feature. 
The physical flash offset is computed as below:
physical offset = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE[3:0]
bitfields.description:
Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped
NOTE: FlexSPI remap size cannot exceed the start address of boot image 1.  
b'0000   Remap size = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte
"   SIZE_OFFSET "Size of the remapped area (aka second half) is same as first half. It is determined by FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET Field. 
b'0001   SIZE_1MB Size of remapped area is 1MByte.                            
b'0010   SIZE_2MB Size of remapped area is 2MByte.                            
b'0011   SIZE_3MB Size of remapped area is 3MByte.                           
b'0100   SIZE_4MB Size of remapped area is 4MByte.
b'0101   SIZE_5MB Size of remapped area is 5MByte.                            
b'0110   SIZE_6MB Size of remapped area is 6MByte.                            
b'0111   SIZE_7MB Size of remapped area is 7MByte.                            
b'1000   SIZE_8MB Size of remapped area is 8MByte.                            
b'1001   SIZE_9MB Size of remapped area is 9MByte.                            
b'1010   SIZE_10MB Size of remapped area is 10MByte.                         
b'1011   SIZE_11MB Size of remapped area is 11MByte.                         
b'1100   SIZE_12MB Size of remapped area is 12MByte.                         
b'1101   SIZE_256KB Size of remapped area is 256KByte.                       
b'1110   SIZE_512KB Size of remapped area is 512KByte.                      
b'1111  SIZE_768KB Size of remapped area is 768KByte.

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_EN[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Secure boot enforcement. 
This field defines the minimum image verification procedure (CRC32, CMAC, ECDSA sign).
The Image type field in header indicates the type of verification data (checksum or signature) included in it. 
Plain < CRC32 < CMAC < ECDSA

values.name: CRC32_IMAGES
values.description: Only CRC32 or signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed.

values.name: SIGNED_IMAGES
values.description: Only Signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed.

values.name: ECDSA_SIGNED
values.description: Only ECDSA signed images are allowed.

bitfields.name: LP_SEC_BOOT[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Secure boot option for low-power wake from power-down & deep-powerdown.
For CFPA/CMPA do CRC check always.

values.name: CHECK_CRC32
values.description: CRC check for  CFPA/CMPA & CRC32 check of active image

values.name: CHECK_JUMP
values.description: CRC check for  CFPA/CMPA & jump to vector address specified in CFPA.

values.name: CHECK_CMAC
values.description: CRC check for  CFPA/CMPA & CMAC check of active image

bitfields.name: ENF_CNSA[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Enforce CNSA suite approved algorithms for secure boot, secure update and debug authentication.
Note, CMAC image authentication is only allowed in 2b'00 setting.

values.name: LIMITED
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used.

values.name: LIMITED
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used.

values.name: LIMITED
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 & AES256 algorithms are used.

bitfields.name: ENF_TZM_PRESET[1:0]
bitfields.description: TrustZone-M mode.

values.name: ENFORCE
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

values.name: ENFORCE
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

values.name: ENFORCE
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bitfields.name: ITRC_ZEROIZE[1:0]
bitfields.description:
RAM zeroize on ITRC event.
Zeroize long-term storage RAM (RAMA) on subsequent boot when Intrusion & Tamper control signals an intrusion event (ITRC_OUT3).
Note, when ITRC is re-configured in application then ITRC_OUT4 (CHIP_RESET) should be triggered with at least same events as ITRC_OUT3 (RAM_ZEROIZE).

values.name: PKC_RAM_ON_ITRC
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC  RAM on ITRC event only.

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ON_ITRC
values.description: Zeroize PKC & RAMA on ITRC event only.

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ALL_RESET
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC & RAMA on all reset boot.

bitfields.name: ACTIVE_IMG_PROT[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Protection of active image. 
This field defines protection of flash area occupied by the active image. Only applicable to internal flash.

values.name: FLASH_ACL_PROTECTION
values.description: Protection is defined using the CFPA FLASH_ACL settings.

values.name: WITH_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC2 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

values.name: NO_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area without sticky lock. GLBAC4 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

values.name: XOM_PROTECTION
values.description: XOM protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC6 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

bitfields.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN[1:0]
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for SHA2 block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_AES_STEN[1:0]
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for AES block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER

values.name: FAILURE ISP

bitfields.description: Enable self-test for KDF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

bitfields.name: SKIP_DICE
bitfields.description: Skip DICE computation.

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bitfields.description: Include NXP area (IFR1) containing specific part configuration data defined during chip manufacturing process in DICE computation.

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_CUST_CFG
bitfields.description: Include data from CMPA page (512 bytes) in DICE computation.

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX0[1:0]
bitfields.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 0 settings.
Flash programming ROM API enforces the erase check. When erase check is enabled all sectors selected in the context should be erased together and only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap.

values.name: LOCKED
values.description: Region is locked. But no erase check.

values.name: LOCKED
values.description: Region is locked. Erase check enabled.

values.name: LOCKED
values.description: Region is locked. Erase check enabled.

bitfields.description:

Flash programming ROM API enforces the erase check. When erase check is enabled all sectors selected in the context should be erased together and only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap.

values.name: LOCKED
values.description: Region is locked. But no erase check.

values.name: LOCKED
values.description: Region is locked. Erase check enabled.

values.name: LOCKED
values.description: Region is locked. Erase check enabled.

registers.name: ROTKH0
registers.description: Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 0 (ROTKH[31:0])

bitfields.name: ROTKH[31:0]
bitfields.description:
Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 0 (ROTKH[31:0])
SHA384 ROTKH[383:352] / SHA56 ROTKH[255:224]

registers.name: ROTKH1
registers.description: Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 1 (ROTKH[63:32])

bitfields.name: ROTKH[63:32]
bitfields.description:
Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 1 (ROTKH[63:32])
SHA384 ROTKH[351:320] / SHA56 ROTKH[223:192]

registers.name: ROTKH2
registers.description: Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 2 (ROTKH[95:64])

bitfields.name: ROTKH[95:64]
bitfields.description:
Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 2 (ROTKH[95:64])
SHA384 ROTKH[319:288] / SHA56 ROTKH[191:160]

registers.name: ROTKH3
registers.description: Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 3 (ROTKH[127:96])

bitfields.name: ROTKH[127:96]
bitfields.description:
Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 3 (ROTKH[127:96])
SHA384 ROTKH[287:256] / SHA56 ROTKH[159:128]

registers.name: ROTKH4
registers.description: Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 4 (ROTKH[159:128])

bitfields.name: ROTKH[159:128]
bitfields.description:
Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 4 (ROTKH[159:128])
SHA384 ROTKH[255:224] / SHA56 ROTKH[127:96]

registers.name: ROTKH5
registers.description: Root of Trust Keys Table Hash 5 (ROTKH[191:160])

bitfields.name: ROTKH[191:160]
bitfields.description:

registers.name: NPX_CTX0_WD0
registers.description: Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 0 (sectors 0 - 31)

bitfields.name: NPX_CTX0_WD0
bitfields.description:
Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 0 (sectors 0 - 31)
ROM copies this value to NPX->VMAPCTX0_WD0 register during flash initialization. This bitmask indicates which 32KB block is encrypted/decrypted using CTX0 key & IV. NPX_CTX0_WD0[31:0]

registers.name: NPX_CTX0_WD1
registers.description: Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 0 (sectors 32 - 63)

registers.name: IPED_CTX_CRC32
registers.description: CRC value of the IPED regions start and end address setting

bitfields.name: IPED_CTX_CRC32
bitfields.description:
CRC value of the IPED regions start and end address setting
User has to program CRC32 of IPED context configuration data present in CMPA (0x0100_40B0 - 0x0100_40EF) to have ROM do integrity check of IPED configuration data before using. This check is done only when this field is non-zero.IPED_CTX_CRC32[31:0]
